name: tools4BCI - TiA
body:
### Why?
TiA (TOBI interface A) is a proposal for a standardized interface to transmit raw biosignals, with a focus on BCI (brain-computer interface) systems. 

### Features
* Multirate transfer
* TCP or UDP data transmission possible
* Block-oriented transfer
* Division into various signal types
* Multiple clients
* Low resource requirements
* Exchange of meta-information between client and server
* Currently in development: Connection based channel selection and downsampling


###  Code
The TiA library is written in C++. The Code is available [here](https://github.com/tools4BCI/TiA).
To get r/w access to the TiA repository, please get in touch with: Christian Breitwieser -- c.breitwieser(at)tugraz(dot)at 

### Building the TiA library 
####Linux & Co. 		
Under a Linux or Unix based distribution, the TiA library is utilizing the [qmake](http://doc.qt.io/qt-5/qmake-manual.html) build system from the [Qt](https://www.qt.io) library. The respective '.pro' and '.pri' files (qmake config files) are included in the SignalServer repo. It is suggested to use the [Qt Creater](https://www.qt.io/ide/) as an IDE under Linux, as it fully supports qmake.

#### Windows
The TiA library source is shipped with a Microsoft Visual C++ 2010 solution file (.sln) and the needed project files (.vcxproj) to build the SignalServer. This solution files are also suitable for the Visual C++ Express Edition. 

##### TiA library dependencies:
[boost-libs](http://www.boost.org/): system, thread, date_time

_Using Linux, those libraries are usually included in the repositories of the respective distributions._

### Documentation
* Doxygen doku (public interface -- for library users)
* Doxygen doku (complete TiA library -- for library developers)
* [TiA specifications](http://arxiv.org/abs/1103.4717)
* [IEEE TiA paper](http://ieeexplore.ieee.org/xpls/abs_all.jsp?arnumber=6111272) describing the intention and the features of TiA (restricted access)
